Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with water and a plant without water.
The student can show how the plant with water is healthy, using details like green leaves.
The student can show how the plant without water looks unhealthy, using details like drooping leaves or brown spots.
The student can use drawings to show that plants need water to live and grow.
The student can include labels or images to show that plants also need light to live and grow.
